intro: Adenandra sonderi var. glabricalyx, commonly known as the smooth-leaved adenandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are smooth to the touch, as indicated by its varietal name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
